snippet: A disease that has killed millions of bats across 16 states and Canada has been found in Missouri, spelling possible trouble for agriculture in the region, officials said Monday.
abstract: White nose syndrome, a fungal disease that has killed millions of bats across 16 states and Canada, is found in Missouri, marking its advent west of the Mississippi; officials worry that spread of disease could affect agriculture in the region because bats subsist on crop pests.
lead_paragraph: A disease that has killed millions of bats across 16 states and Canada has been found in Missouri, spelling possible trouble for agriculture in the region, officials said Monday.
